remarks: Pronoun "These" resolved to timeless stories derived from famous fairytales.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Narrative works or stories emotionally captivate or enchant their audience.
args.justification: Both relations describe the same affective effect: timeless stories emotionally enchanting their audience (readers or listeners). A single predicate 'enchants_audience' cleanly captures this audience-directed emotional impact.
These relations concern the emotional/affective impact of narrative content on its audience, fitting a class centered on audience affective responses to works.
The primary semantics involve the emotional or affective effect (enchantment, captivation) of stories on audiences rather than composition, hierarchy, or causality in a narrow physical sense.
